title: Find the value of a definite integral by geometry

content.question: The graph of the function f shown above consists of two line segments and a semicircle. Let g be defined by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mi>x</mi> </msubsup> <mtext> </mtext> </mrow> </mstyle><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@477A@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. What is the value of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mn>5</mn> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>?</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A2A@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

topic.text: 6.5: Interpreting the Behavior of Accumulation Functions Involving Area

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Use appropriate units of measure.
